words.definition: If something is broad, it is wide.
words.example: The river is very long and broad.

words.definition: A bush is a plant with many thin branches. It is smaller than a tree.
words.example: My dad and I planted some small bushes around the house.

words.definition: If someone or something is capable of something, they can do it.
words.example: The Olympic athlete is capable of lifting a lot of weight.

words.definition: To cheat is to be dishonest so that you can win or do well.
words.example: They cheated on the test by sharing answers.

words.definition: To concentrate on someone or something is to give your full attention.
words.example: I could not concentrate on my homework because of the noise.

words.definition: To conclude is to arrive at a logical end by looking at evidence.
words.example: I saw the wet grass and concluded that it had rained.

words.definition: If you are confident, you are sure of yourself or an outcome.
words.example: I am confident that I will pass the test.

words.definition: If something is considerable, it is large in size, amount, or extent.
words.example: They made a considerable amount of money.

words.definition: To convey is to communicate or make an idea known.
words.example: The artist used color to convey a sense of sadness.

words.definition: If something is definite, it is certain or clear.
words.example: I have a definite plan for the weekend.

words.definition: Delight is a feeling of very great happiness.
words.example: The children's delight was obvious when they saw the puppies.

words.definition: A destination is the place where someone or something is going.
words.example: We reached our destination after a long flight.

words.definition: To dictate is to read or say something aloud so that someone else can write it down.
words.example: The boss dictated a letter to his secretary.

words.definition: The edge is the part of something where it ends or meets another surface.
words.example: He sat on the edge of the bed.

words.definition: A path is a track that people walk along.
words.example: We followed the path through the forest.

words.definition: A resort is a place where many people go for a vacation.
words.example: We stayed at a beautiful beach resort.

words.definition: A shadow is the dark shape made when something blocks the light.
words.example: The sun made a long shadow on the ground.

words.definition: To succeed is to do something you were trying to do.
words.example: I hope you succeed in your new job.

words.definition: To suspect is to believe that something is true or that someone did something.
words.example: I suspect that he is lying.

words.definition: A valley is an area of low land between mountains or hills.
words.example: The river flows through the valley.
